MultiRegVariablesMix 0.1.0
  • Reference

Multinomial Regression Model

Source: R/MultinomialRegression.R
MultinomialRegression.Rd

This class implements a multinomial regression model using R6, with support for preprocessing, softmax activation, and gradient-based optimization.

Public fields

X

The input matrix (features), with an added bias term.

y

The target variable (labels).

W

The weight matrix of the model.

optimizer

The optimizer used for updating weights.

epochs

The number of epochs for training.

batch_size

The batch size for mini-batch gradient descent.

preprocessor

An instance of the Preprocessor class for data preprocessing.

optimizer_type

The type of optimizer used (e.g., "momentum", "rmsprop", "adam").

learning_rate

The learning rate for gradient descent.

beta1

The beta1 parameter for optimizers like Adam and RMSprop.

beta2

The beta2 parameter for the Adam optimizer.

epsilon

A small value to prevent division by zero in optimizers.

l1_ratio

The L1 regularization ratio.

a

The regularization strength parameter.

label_mappings

A mapping of class labels.

data_preprocessed

A flag indicating if the data has been preprocessed.

cost_history

A vector storing the cost at each epoch.

Method new()

Initializes the multinomial regression model.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$new(
  encoding_type = c("label", "one-hot", "afdm"),
  optimizer_type = c("momentum", "rmsprop", "gd", "adam"),
  learning_rate = 0.01,
  epochs = 10000,
  batch_size = NULL,
  beta1 = 0.9,
  beta2 = 0.999,
  epsilon = 1e-08,
  a = 0,
  l1_ratio = 0
)

Arguments

encoding_type

The type of encoding for categorical variables ("label", "one-hot", "afdm").

optimizer_type

The optimizer type ("momentum", "rmsprop", "gd", "adam").

learning_rate

The learning rate for the optimizer (default: 0.01).

epochs

The number of epochs for training (default: 10000).

batch_size

The batch size for mini-batch gradient descent.

beta1

The beta1 parameter for momentum-based optimizers (default: 0.9).

beta2

The beta2 parameter for Adam optimizer (default: 0.999).

epsilon

A small value to prevent division by zero in optimizers (default: 1e-8).

a

The regularization strength parameter (default: 0).

l1_ratio

The L1 regularization ratio (default: 0).

Method softmax()

Computes the softmax function for a given input matrix.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$softmax(z)

Arguments

z

A numeric matrix of logits.

Returns

A matrix of probabilities.

Method one_hot_encode()

Converts a vector of class labels into a one-hot encoded matrix.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$one_hot_encode(y, K)

Arguments

y

A vector of class labels.

K

The number of unique classes.

Returns

A one-hot encoded matrix.

Method explore_famd()

Performs a Factorial Analysis of Mixed Data (FAMD) for exploratory analysis.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$explore_famd(data)

Arguments

data

The dataset to analyze.

Method preprocess()

Preprocesses the data using the preprocessor instance.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$preprocess(X, y = NULL, is_training = TRUE, ncp = NULL)

Arguments

X

The feature matrix.

y

The target vector (optional).

is_training

A boolean indicating if the data is for training.

ncp

Number of components to retain during dimensionality reduction (optional).

Method fit()

Fits the model to the given data.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$fit(X = NULL, y = NULL, preprocess = TRUE, ncp = NULL)

Arguments

X

The feature matrix.

y

The target vector.

preprocess

A boolean indicating if the data should be preprocessed.

ncp

Number of components to retain during dimensionality reduction (optional).

Method plot_cost_evolution()

Plots the cost evolution during training.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$plot_cost_evolution()

Returns

A ggplot object visualizing the cost evolution.

Method plot_prediction_distribution()

Plots the distribution of predictions by class.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$plot_prediction_distribution(X, y_true = NULL)

Arguments

X

The input data for generating predictions.

y_true

Optional true class labels for comparison.

Returns

A ggplot object visualizing the distribution of predictions.

Method predict()

Predicts the class labels for the given input data.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$predict(X)

Arguments

X

The input data matrix.

Returns

A vector of predicted class labels.

Method predict_proba()

Predicts the class probabilities for the given input data.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$predict_proba(X)

Arguments

X

The input data matrix.

Returns

A matrix of predicted probabilities for each class.

Method var_importance()

Computes the importance of each variable based on model weights.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$var_importance()

Returns

A named vector of variable importance scores, sorted in decreasing order.

Method var_select()

Selects variables based on a given importance threshold.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$var_select(threshold = 0.75)

Arguments

threshold

The quantile threshold for variable selection (default: 0.75).

Returns

A subset of the input matrix X containing selected variables.

Method plot_confusion_matrix()

Plots the confusion matrix for the given true and predicted labels.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$plot_confusion_matrix(y_true, y_pred, classes = NULL)

Arguments

y_true

The true class labels.

y_pred

The predicted class labels.

classes

Optional vector of class labels. If NULL, derived from y_true and y_pred.

Returns

A ggplot object visualizing the confusion matrix.

Method plot_roc()

Plots the ROC curves for a multi-class classification model.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$plot_roc(X, y_true)

Arguments

X

The input data.

y_true

The true class labels.

Returns

A ggplot object visualizing the ROC curves.

Method print()

Prints a brief summary of the model and its current state.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$print()

Returns

Prints information about the model.

Method summary()

Provides a detailed summary of the model, its data, and its training status.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$summary()

Returns

Prints a detailed summary of the model.

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

MultinomialRegression$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.
